GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_SECTION_DESC: Configure shutdown button GPIO. Triggers shutdown when Pi is running. For wake-from-halt, GPIO3 with diode circuit required (see README). Changes require reboot.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_PIN_DOC: GPIO pin number for shutdown button. Only triggers shutdown when Pi is running.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_TYPE_DOC: NO = Normally Open (most common), NC = Normally Closed
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_TYPE_DESC: Select based on your button wiring.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_DEBOUNCE_DOC: Debounce time in milliseconds to prevent false triggers from button contact bounce.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.BUTTON_DEBOUNCE_DESC: Default = 100. Increase if button triggers multiple times per press.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.LED_SECTION_DESC: Configure LED indicator GPIOs. LED is wired between two GPIO pins. IMPORTANT: Use 330-470 ohm resistor in series! Changes apply immediately.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.LED_POS_PIN_DOC: GPIO pin for LED positive (anode) connection.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.LED_NEG_PIN_DOC: GPIO pin for LED negative (cathode) connection.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.LED_POLARITY_DOC: Reverse polarity if LED lights when it should be off.
GPIO_BUTTON_LED.LED_POLARITY_DESC: Normal: LED+ HIGH = ON. Reversed: LED+ LOW = ON.
